page.title: 01FARMING
page.content: A large farm in our area has many fields which appear to be just grass. The farmer said that he relies on the grass to feed his sheep and cows. The cows are kept in order to produce milk Each cow has one calf each year in order to keep up the prodution of milk. Some calves are kept to replace the cows. The farmer also keeps some sheep. He specialises in suppling other farms with rams. The grass grown on half of the fields is cut and kept for winter feed. The farmer explained the process of producing silage. He compared it with making jam. The grass is cut and packed tight and it heats up natuarally This allows the lactic bugs to preserve it. It is covered with rolls of plastic to keep the air out and old tyres are placed on top to weigh it down. He doesn't make hay as it needs to be dry.
